Articles.Content: In 0.25 the mod appears to work, but the batteries welded to the lights no longer appear in the model. Should be pretty trivial to fix. Simply change the old battery names to Squad's new battery names.
I would like a maintenance too
Wouldn't mind seeing this updated myself.
This is a really beautiful part. I wish it better worked with newer versions.

Somehow never saw this part. Decided to fix it for .90 Still works great. Here's how to do it yourself.

Grab the current Vanguard Technologies dll from its thread, link in this mods OP is out of date. Install it.

Next go to this mods folder (...\gamedata\ASET\StackInlineLightsRGB) and edit the following two files (open them with notepad, they're just text files):

part02-250bat3000.cfg change line 17 where it references the battery model to read "model=Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-4kBattery/model"

part02-250bat300.cfg change the 4 lines that reference the battery model to read "model=Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-100Battery/model"

That's it, good to go!

Now pardon me, I have to go stick these on EVERYTHING.
I used to use the dockbright parts but the docking port is no longer showing up can anyone assist

Next go to this mods folder (...\gamedata\ASET\StackInlineLightsRGB) and edit the following two files (open them with notepad, they're just text files):

That's it, good to go!

Now pardon me, I have to go stick these on EVERYTHING.

The problem with the part is it doesn't work well with stock lights. They use different lighting code. Inline Lights had color changing before Squad did it, but did it differently.
Bumping in the hope of some update love...
Whats wrong with them ?

Whats wrong with them ?
The problem with the part is it doesn't work well with stock lights. They use different lighting code. Inline Lights had color changing before Squad did it, but did it differently.
I used to use the dockbright parts but the docking port is no longer showing up can anyone assist
Somehow never saw this part. Decided to fix it for .90 Still works great. Here's how to do it yourself.

Grab the current Vanguard Technologies dll from its thread, link in this mods OP is out of date. Install it.

Next go to this mods folder (...\gamedata\ASET\StackInlineLightsRGB) and edit the following two files (open them with notepad, they're just text files):

part02-250bat3000.cfg change line 17 where it references the battery model to read "model=Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-4kBattery/model"

part02-250bat300.cfg change the 4 lines that reference the battery model to read "model=Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-100Battery/model"

Seems like the mod hasn't been updated since 0.24. From the sounds of things it is not set up to use tweakables and some of the parts don't show in the editor. Links are out of date in the OP. A CKAN entry would be nice too.

Now that the author has some spare time it seems as though it may get some love again so I was posting to show them that this mod is still loved and an update would be welcome.

You don't have to use twewakables with the Vanguard plugin there you can change the color in flight will look at the docking ports bet there looking at the wrong path.

EDIT- Here is a fix for the docking ports with lights just renamed the paths https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/72893034/ASET_DockingPorts.zip

OP links fixed.

VGN is required for full functionality
holy crap its great to see you back Alexustas!!
Huh, I always thought that once coloring of lights was introduced in the stock game that VGN would be rather obsolete for coloring the lights.
Any ETA for KONQUEST?
Someone had to bring up Konquest. I wanted to, but I don't want to scare him off. But I do so want to hear more about that mod than these little light thingies.

VGN is required for full functionality

Out of curiosity, what functionality would we be missing if we don't have the VGN plug-in installed? I looked at the CFG file(s) and compared them to the stock spotlights. The module call for basic lights look essentially the same. The only difference I see is the extra call for the VGN plugin module. With 0.90 (and I guess 1.0 soon) offering built-in colored lighting via the right-click tweakables, what's the added benefit of including VGN? (Other than presets, judging from the video. And I guess custom emissives?)

VNG you can do it any time even in flight stock tweakables just in vab.

EDIT- Plus with VNG you can get EVA chutes also.

All the nodes just need a - on the bottom node

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.10, 0.0, 0.0, -1.0, 0.0, 2
so when will this be updated to 1.0?

so when will this be updated to 1.0?

Here is a patch that will update them https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/72893034/help/StackInlineLightsRGB_Patch.cfg.zip

Thank you Sir!
